alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:20PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Anderson and central Knox Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clinton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Halls, Maloneyville, Lake Forest, Mascot, Bearden, Powell and Karns. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
